cs21120.assignment2

Interface ISnapper


  • public interface ISnapper
    This is the interface you need to implement in order to calculate the shortest paths to a selected point

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.LinkedList<java.awt.Point> getPath(int x, int y)
      Gets the path from the specified point back to the seed point This method is called on mouseDragged events.
      void setSeed(int x, int y, FloatImage[] edges)
      Set the start point for the estimation of the shortest paths The edge images contain the edge weights to use from pixel (x,y) to {(x+1, y), (x+1, y+1), (x, y+1) and (x-1, y+1)} in that order The weights in the other 8 directions can be found by symmetry as the graph is undirected.

    • Method Detail

      • setSeed

        void setSeed(int x,
           int y,
           FloatImage[] edges)
        Set the start point for the estimation of the shortest paths The edge images contain the edge weights to use from pixel (x,y) to {(x+1, y), (x+1, y+1), (x, y+1) and (x-1, y+1)} in that order The weights in the other 8 directions can be found by symmetry as the graph is undirected. This method is called on mousePressed events
        Parameters:
        x - The x-location of the seed point
        y - The y-location of the seed point
        edges - The edge images containing the weights to use between pixels in the order {E, NE, N, NW}

      • getPath

        java.util.LinkedList<java.awt.Point> getPath(int x,
                                           int y)
        Gets the path from the specified point back to the seed point This method is called on mouseDragged events.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the specified point
        y - the y-coordinate of the specified point
        Returns:
        should return a linked list of java.awt.Point representing the shortest path
